channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @wordpaley Bruce Cockburn: “I learned as a child not to trust in my body I've carried that burden through my life But there's a day when we all have to be pried loose” https://t.co/WyP6fUFyd7

item.description: @trekonomics Question prompted by your earlier tweet re: libertarianism: Is there any European equivalent of the Lochner case, in which the Supreme Court ruled basic worker regulation unconstitutional?
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics Question prompted by your earlier tweet re: libertarianism: Is there any European equivalent of the Lochner case, in which the Supreme Court ruled basic worker regulation unconstitutional?

item.description: @EladNehorai What is the demand the original (false) tweet sought to meet? Is there a better way to meet the demand? Is the demand itself problematic and should it be countered? If so, how?
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai What is the demand the original (false) tweet sought to meet? Is there a better way to meet the demand? Is the demand itself problematic and should it be countered? If so, how?

item.description: @AD_Lobel Not enough investment in time travel in Jewish spaces

item.description:
@AD_Lobel Interesting book on that topic I enjoyed reading: https://t.co/Yz1L4TERKs

@AD_Lobel A bit dry, a bit disjointed, but among other things asks the questions: What if the book of Samuel/Kings is just propaganda for an illegitimate Davidic dynasty that tried to subvert the ancient Israelite constitution?
item.source:markdown:
@AD_Lobel Interesting book on that topic I enjoyed reading: https://t.co/Yz1L4TERKs

item.description: @HannahLebovits I will never resist the opportunity to remind people that the Orthodox rabbi who brought the phrase “family values” into Republican discourse (a Dan Quayle speechwriter in his congregation stole it from a sermon) was Barry Freundel.
item.source:markdown: @HannahLebovits I will never resist the opportunity to remind people that the Orthodox rabbi who brought the phrase “family values” into Republican discourse (a Dan Quayle speechwriter in his congregation stole it from a sermon) was Barry Freundel.

item.description:
@AD_Lobel @NASAArtemis But you’d think God would smile more on a mission with Zohar on board.

@AD_Lobel @NASAArtemis (Zohar in this case being not the sacred book of Divine secrets, but a made-in-Israel test dummy.) and

item.description: @Namer98 @DBashIdeas Many fond Shabbos memories of playing with my kid. What parents need to know is that underneath the infinite complexity it’s actually simple, and if you’re not playing competitively it’s both fun and easy.
item.source:markdown: @Namer98 @DBashIdeas Many fond Shabbos memories of playing with my kid. What parents need to know is that underneath the infinite complexity it’s actually simple, and if you’re not playing competitively it’s both fun and easy.
